lead_paragraph: Gov. Pete Wilson said today that he would hold a clemency hearing for the convicted murderer Robert Alton Harris, who is scheduled to be executed next month for killing two San Diego teen-agers in 1978. In his 13 years on death row, Mr. Harris, 39 years old, has blocked four execution dates through various court proceedings. Earlier this month, a Federal appellate court refused to block a fifth date, and April 21 was set for the execution. It would be the first execution in California in 25 years.
